sources.title: Great Guy
sources.description: James Cagney plays the plucky Irish crusader, Johnny Cave, who fights against corruption at the Weights And Measures Department. James Cagney is great in this movie. It shows why he was such a huge movie star

sources.title: Great Guy (1936)
sources.description: A meat inspector sets out to rid his town of payoff deals affecting the quality of meat being sold to the public. Watch on RetroFlix:Â  https://retroflix.org/great-guy-1936/

sources.title: Great Guy (1936) JAMES CAGNEY
sources.description:
Stars: James Cagney, Mae Clarke and James Burke
Director: John G. Blystone

An ex-boxer accepts an appointment to serve as head of the Bureau of Weights and Measures. However, when he discovers that his organization is full of corruption and lies, he sets out to uncover the scam, much to the dismay of his girlfriend!

metadata.Plot: It's the New York Department of Weights and Measures vs. a systematic effort to cheat the public by giving them less product than they pay for...organized by crooked city alderman Marty Cavanaugh, who put the last chief deputy inspector in the hospital. The new man, pugnacious Johnny Cave, steps on the toes of influential merchants and gets increasing pressure, both political and strong-arm, to desist. Will the luck (if not the pluck) of the Irish pull him through?
metadata.Writer: James Edward Grant, Henry McCarty, Henry Johnson
metadata.Actors: James Cagney, Mae Clarke, James Burke
